channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Primary 1 registration: 99 primary schools headed for ballot in Phase 2C
item.description:
August 13, 2020 1:58 PM

SINGAPORE - Parents hoping to clinch a spot for their children at 99 popular primary schools in Phase 2C of the Primary 1 registration exercise will have to face a ballot.

item.title: LTA makes partial reversals to changes in Bukit Panjang bus routes after week-long discussions, petitions
item.description:
August 13, 2020 1:34 PM

SINGAPORE - The Land Transport Authority (LTA) has partially reversed some of its plans to make changes to key bus services in Bukit Panjang after unhappiness from residents and week-long discussions with stakeholders.

item.title: New digital transformation plan for training and adult education sector launched
item.description:
August 13, 2020 11:37 AM

Minister of State for Education and Manpower Gan Siow Huang highlighted three main shifts the training and adult education sector has to make to reposition itself for the new normal.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 13
item.description:
August 13, 2020 8:00 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Thursday, Aug 13.

item.title: 15 months' jail for former Sats officer who took multiple bribes
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

A former Sats officer was sentenced to 15 months' jail for eight corruption charges involving a total sum of more than $150,000 yesterday.

item.title: Over 7,800 new BTO flats on offer in eight estates
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

House hunters who could not apply for a Build-To-Order (BTO) flat in May now have plenty of options as 7,862 new flats in eight estates were launched for sale by the Housing Board yesterday.

item.title: MAS urges financial institutions to grow Singaporean talent pool
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Financial institutions should continue to identify Singaporeans with high potential for leadership roles and expand the supply of talented locals, the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) said yesterday.

item.title: Istana virtual tour among ST projects feted at prestigious global awards
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Take in the sights and sounds of the Istana from a bird's eye view, before swooping in up close for intimate details of its main building and little-known spots - all without stepping into the national monument.

item.title: A number of projects in latest BTO sales exercise may take up to five years to complete
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

A number of projects in the mega Build-To-Order (BTO) sales exercise yesterday may take up to five years to complete due to safety measures introduced at construction sites to curb Covid-19.

item.title: Banks say they keep strong local core in workforce
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Banks in Singapore said they keep a strong local core in the workforce, while growing the pipeline of local talent.

item.title: Jail for woman who received, transferred scam proceeds
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

A 64-year-old woman continued to use her bank accounts to receive funds from people she did not know, despite receiving repeated warnings by the Commercial Affairs Department (CAD) not to do so.

item.title: DPM Heng Swee Keat assures business, union leaders of continued support
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Keat has assured business and union leaders that workers and companies will continue to get support as the recession deepens and the Jobs Support Scheme (JSS) ends.

item.title: Spur global digital economy for next lap of growth: Chan Chun Sing
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Amid technological and trade tensions between the United States and China, it is important to uphold a rules-based trading system and develop the global digital economy for the next lap of growth, said Trade and Industry Minister Chan Chun Sing.

item.title: Man gets jail for causing hurt resulting in death
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Coffee shop owner Tan Beng Gim, 52, was sentenced to eight months' jail yesterday, after pleading guilty to a charge of voluntarily causing hurt in an altercation that resulted in a 51-year-old man's death.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trial to let workers leave dorms for errands
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Some workers living in dormitories will, from later this month, be able to leave their dorms to visit centres where they can buy groceries and SIM cards, and remit money to their loved ones back home.

item.title: Couple who built gate, two boundary walls and fence on state land charged
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The structures around the house in Jalan Kayu estate are said to have been built in December 2005.

item.title: Drug trafficker fails in 2nd bid to raise legal questions
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The Court of Appeal yesterday rejected a bid by a British drug trafficker to raise legal questions related to his sentence of 20 years' jail and 24 strokes of the cane for two sets of drug offences committed in 2016 and 2018.

item.title: More work-study opportunities in emerging and growth sectors
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporeans will be offered more work-study opportunities in emerging and growth sectors with the introduction of four new SkillsFuture work-study programmes.

item.title: Siblings found guilty of offences involving $2.2 million in bribes
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Two Singaporean siblings conspired to secure tenders for two companies in China in exchange for bribes amounting to about 11.3 million yuan (S$2.2 million).

item.title: RSS Supreme to take part in Exercise Rimpac
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

RSS Supreme, a Formidable-class frigate from the Republic of Singapore Navy (RSN), will participate in this year's Rim of the Pacific (Rimpac) Exercise, which will take place in Hawaii from Monday to Aug 31.

item.title: Rules eased to help construction sector find its feet; 40,000 workers set to benefit
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Thousands of workers can restart work without employers needing BCA approval for jobs that require relatively few workers, such as lift maintenance and renovation work.

item.title: Temasek arm, SIA to help move essential supplies
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Airlines (SIA) and the Temasek Foundation will help transport essential medical supplies and other humanitarian items by air to points of need around the world, in a new partnership with the World Food Programme (WFP).

item.title: Jail, fine for married man who shot videos of friends, family showering
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

A man who wrote a sexual fantasy story planted cameras in various bathrooms, including his own, to record his family members and church friends showering.

item.title: Appeal of live online auctions at Tekka Market short-lived
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Introduced in the midst of Singapore's circuit breaker period in May, Tekka Market's live online auctions promised much as an innovative and digital way to buy wet market essentials.

item.title: Social sector needs bold, innovative leaders: President Halimah
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The social sector needs leaders who can come up with creative ways to help Singapore's vulnerable groups, whose lives and livelihoods have been upset by the Covid-19 pandemic, said President Halimah Yacob.

item.title: Vicom's half-year profits down 30% to $9.7m
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The circuit breaker period, which slowed the vehicle inspection business to a trickle, dragged Vicom's half-year profits down by 30 per cent to $9.7 million.

item.title: Coronavirus: SIA, SilkAir offer cabin crew early release, retirement
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

National carrier Singapore Airlines (SIA) is offering its cabin crew early release or retirement as it continues efforts to cut costs amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Plans for new association, centre to boost plastics recycling in S'pore
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singaporean-German Chamber of Industry and Commerce (SGC) has announced plans to establish a Plastics Recycling Association and a Centre of Excellence for recycling here, with the eventual goal of turning Singapore into a regional hub of excellence in plastics recycling.

item.title: Best defence against Covid-19 second wave is caution
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

If people start thinking that the pandemic is now history in Singapore then, as they say, history has a habit of repeating itself, says senior health correspondent Salma Khalik.

item.title: NDP organisers apologise for errors in Tamil lyrics during live broadcast
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The organisers of the National Day Parade (NDP) this year have apologised for errors in the Tamil text that was broadcast live on television in the evening show on Sunday.

item.title: Hard-hit construction firms cheer easing of rule on workers' housing
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Builders like Kori Holdings heaved a huge sigh of relief yesterday at the lifting of a rule that had made restarting work on a project more cumbersome.

item.title: HK academic leader to be dean of NTU medical school
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Hong Kong gastroenterologist and academic leader Joseph Sung will be joining Nanyang Technological University (NTU) as the new dean of the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine (LKCMedicine), NTU announced on Tuesday.

item.title: New flats in Bishan after 14 years
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

For the first time in 14 years, 472 new units are up for sale in Bishan, a mature Housing Board estate.

item.title: 42 new coronavirus cases in Singapore - lowest in over 4 months
item.description:
August 13, 2020 5:00 AM

There were 42 new coronavirus cases announced by the Health Ministry yesterday, taking Singapore's total to 55,395.

item.title: Strengthening food security with R&D
item.description:
August 13, 2020 4:00 AM

The current Covid-19 situation has brought the issue of food security into sharper focus. Here's how A*STAR and the Singapore Food Agency are driving R&D efforts to strengthen the country's food safety and supply

item.title: DPM Heng Swee Keat assures business, union leaders of continued support as recession deepens
item.description:
August 13, 2020 12:20 AM

His comments are the first hint since the latest economic numbers were released on Tuesday that support measures may taper off rather than just come to a stop.
